thread.title: Coast 93.1 strings 3,000 bras across Casco Bay Bridge
thread.title_full: Coast 93.1 strings 3,000 bras across Casco Bay Bridge

title: Coast 93.1 strings 3,000 bras across Casco Bay Bridge
text:
Radio station strings 3,000 bras across Casco Bay Bridge Event raises breast cancer awareness UPDATED 12:43 PM EDT Oct 24, 2015 Photos Blake Hayes 
Radio station Coast 93.1 successfully strung 3,000 bras across the Casco Bay Bridge on Saturday in an event it called "Bras Across the Bridge." More 
WMGX, based out of South Portland, had asked listeners to donate the bras to help fight breast cancer. 
"We had like 50 bras just 3 weeks ago. We put the call out on the radio and ended up with thousands, even more than we needed to get across the entire span of the bridge," morning show co-host Blake Hayes said. "When Eva and I met in the middle -- what a feeling. We had so many survivors helping us, and people touched by cancer -- including a woman who literally came from her last chemo treatment at the hospital to bring her family to the bridge." 
"Their strength is inspiring, and the reason we decided to do this crazy thing," Hayes said. 
Warner Brothers and Epic Records are donating a dollar per bra to the Cancer Community Center in Scarborough. 
The bras will be donated to Goodwill. 
October is National Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
